page.title: 19Fauna
page.content: 1 or 2 new varieties of animals have appeared in the wild state, such as mink, escaping from mink farms. Rabbits are becominmg more numerous, also the mole. Some farmers preserve a small acreage for wildlife as spinneys. Hares are found here, also fallow deer, badgers, foxes, hedgehogs rats, mice, voles, stoat and weasels. Birds of prey include kestrels, little owl, tawny owl, barn owl, crow, magpie, jackdaw. Many migrating birds come over East Anglia to the delight of the many birdwatchers, but the nesting places of the rarer birds is kept secret for fear of egg stealing. All in all, the countryside here is a delight for wildlife. Where else can you see partridges, pheasants, all sorts of finches, the rare fieldfares, woodpecker, robin, wren and many other animals from your kitchen window.
